title: Interop 2022 project aims to fix inconsistent features across web browsers
content:
Most web browsers now share a common rendering engine, Google’s Chromium, but Safari and Firefox also have their own engines that are shared by other projects (such as Tor Browser). Those different architectures mean some web features don’t quite work the same across all browsers, which can become a headache for web developers and people

The post Interop 2022 project aims to fix inconsistent features across web browsers appeared first on xda-developers.
